main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 29th October 1959 over North Kamloops, British Columbia, Canada. The object was described as circular or oval, 1 1/2 - 2 feet in diameter, with a red or orange color. It glowed and was estimated to be traveling at 500 mph with no noticeable features.
interesting points: The UFO was estimated to be 1 1/2 - 2 feet in diameter, with a red or orange color and no noticeable features.
The object was reported to have disappeared over the horizon at 45-270 degrees, traveling at a speed of about 500 knots for 10-15 minutes.
No radar contact was made, and there were no reported air traffic in the area.
The report suggests a possible weather phenomenon, ruling out the balloon possibility due to the reported speed of the object.
Questions were raised in a follow-up communication, requesting clarification on the estimated size of the object, its disappearance, the observer's position, and the estimation of the object's speed.
witnesses: warren g. marvel s/sgt, 825th acwron, comm center specialist, f-6
